definitions.definition: Widespread , common , prevalent , current (mainly of unpleasant or harmful things).
examples: Smallpox was rife after the siege had been lifted.

definitions.definition: Abounding ; present in large numbers, plentiful .
examples: Red deer are rife in these woodlands.
Seeds are rife in a watermelon.

definitions.definition: Full of (mostly unpleasant or harmful things).
examples: Many post-colonial governments were rife with lawlessness and corruption.

main_definition: Widespread , common , prevalent , current (mainly of unpleasant or harmful things).
secondary_definitions: Abounding ; present in large numbers, plentiful .
Full of (mostly unpleasant or harmful things).
